conversation.message: School_C is my absolute top preference. I am deeply committed to joining your academic community and believe my skills align perfectly with your requirements. I formally submit my application now.
conversation.thought:
My objective is to secure the highest possible match. My top choice is School_C. 

I need to analyze the competition for School_C. 
School_C's priority list ranks me (Student_E) 4th out of 5 students: ['Student_B', 'Student_A', 'Student_D', 'Student_E', 'Student_C']. 

I anticipate that in Round 1, most students will apply to their absolute top choice:
- Student_A, B, D are all likely to apply to School_E (their #1).
- Student_C is likely to apply to School_D (their #1).

If all students apply to their #1 choice, School_C will only receive an application from me (Student_E). Since School_C has a capacity of 1, and I am the only applicant, School_C should accept me, even though I am ranked 4th on their list. 

Therefore, applying formally to School_C immediately is the optimal strategy.

However, due to the high volume of early applications and our current selection criteria, we are unable to offer you a spot at this moment. We wish you the best in your search.
